Title:
Nutrient optimization for biomass and polyunsaturated fatty
acids production of Thrautochytrids
Abstract:
This research aims to evaluate the effect of carbon source
and nitrogen source on biomass and PUFAs production of Thraustochytrids.
A total of 30 isolates were obtained from seagrass, seaweed, sea water
and sediment. Fifteen isolates were selected by their morphological
appearance on culture medium. They were evaluated for biomass and PUFAs
production by using six different culture medium and Gas
chromatographyÂ–mass spectrometry, respectively. The highest yields were
obtained from three strains (TC4-TSU, TC6-TSU and TC9-TSU) of
Aurantiochytrium limacinum. Strain TC9-TSU could utilize 6% D-glucose as
carbon source and 1% yeast extract as nitrogen source and showed the
highest biomass at 0.5 g dry cell weight/L. On the other hand, this
strain gave the highest PUFAs production. Docosahexaenoic acid (DHA;
22:6n3) and eicosapentaenic acid (EPA; 20:5n3) were the major components
of the total fatty acid content, comprising about 40% and 25%,
respectively.
